MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thÆ°a mÆ°á»£t mÃ , facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh.####MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ , facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . becomes . MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, mÃ¡y má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ , mÃ¡y facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . However, given the grammatical structure of the sentence, it makes more sense to split as follows:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, mÃ¡y má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ , mÃ¡y facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . is actually incorrect. Here is the correct split:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, mÃ¡y má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ ,  mÃ¡y facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . Actually no, the words "mÃ¡y" added above is incorrect so the correct one should be:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ , vÃ  facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . However "facebook, zalo" and "cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m" do not exactly match the aspect so it's better to leave "facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m," together since "facebook, zalo" can be considered one entity being described by cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, and we get:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thá»© mÆ°á»£t mÃ , vÃ  facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh. . However sinceØ§ØªÛŒ frags are implied, for example for "mÃ¡y" it means "mÃ¡y cá»§a cá»­a hÃ ng nÃ y" or something like this, as for "má»i thá»©" frags implied is "má»i thá»© cá»§a mÃ¡y", or everything of this machine is smooth as for facebook zalo is frags of "cháº¡y trÃªn mÃ¡y", so machine run facebook and zalo smoothly, so it should be:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thá»© cá»§a mÃ¡y mÆ°á»£t mÃ , vÃ  mÃ¡y cháº¡y facebook, zalo cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn cá»§a cá»­a hÃ ng tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh.. And it seems that "cháº¡y Ãªm láº¯m" does describe frags of "facebook, zalo" but seems it does describe "mÃ¡y" as well. Since it can be both so we should pick the frags that have less words added. We then have:. MÃ¡y xÃ i tá»‘t, má»i thá»© cá»§a mÃ¡y mÆ°á»£t mÃ , vÃ  mÃ¡y cháº¡y facebook, zalo Ãªm láº¯m, vÃ  nhÃ¢n viÃªn cá»§a cá»­a hÃ ng tÆ° váº¥n nhiá»‡t tÃ¬nh.

Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ? Hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘####Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ? . MÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘
Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ? Hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘####Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³  dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ?  Hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘ . . becomes . . Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ?  Hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘ . . However, to follow the guidelines and to actually split the sentence with aspect terms, . . Sao ai cÅ©ng khen pin trÃ¢u mÃ  mÃ¬nh tháº¥y nÃ³ dÃ¹ng nhanh xuá»‘ng váº­y ? . Hay lÃ  do mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i váº­y ğŸ˜‘ . . But 'pin' in 'mÃ¡y mÃ¬nh pin lá»—i' was not an aspect term in the given list, so the correct sentence should be separated into two with 'pin' as the aspect term and considering the given aspect term, the first separated sentence contains the subject 'pin' implicitly as 'nÃ³', so we explicit it to .
